segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate, and it’s like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and it’s actually kind of funny how oblivious she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and I can’t help but laugh at how determined he looks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, and it’s so cute how patient she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so surprised when she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, but it’s like she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, and it’s a nice contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will get away with it or if they’ll get caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and it’s like he’s on a mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window is so warm, and it makes everything feel cozy despite the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
